bow: first time mom due in october for all the mommas out there who have been through delivery at hospital thought about posting this in babybumps but would rather hear from mommas who have been through what about to go through what should pack in my hospital bag is there any one item you could live without ll be giving birth in hospital if you have smart phone tablet or laptop bring it pretty much did use anything in my hospital bag but had an emergency section after 48 hours of labor just wanted to be entertained bring anything to entertain and distract yourself lt good luck my dear sine they would allow eating or drinking jolly ranchers kept my mouth moist and staved off nausea they were the one thing was gladdest to have you may also want to bring your own light robe it gets chilly did not wear any of the clothing took it was just easier to nurse in the hospital gown but do recommend that you take comfy socks slippers your smart phone tablet laptop and any personal hygiene products you need to be comfortable for me this meant charmin wipes hospital toilet paper is pretty shabby also took my own pillow and that really helped me sleep better if you want to get any sleep at all during your early labor or later on if you get an epidural and after delivery bring ear plugs and an eye cover did do this for but did for one emergency and one planned and it made all the difference in the world after delivery especially if your room is right next to the nurses station like mine was both times bring some slippers that you re willing to throw out nuke in hot water after you get home your own pillow makes big difference also brought nursing tank with me for both kids and it helped support my ginormous boobies after the titty fairy came to visit and my milk came in wore it with some comfy pj pants good luck love jolly ranchers good idea thank you should be concerned of my favorite robe getting too dirty to bring home that is great idea to take my own pillow would have thought of that thank you excepting outfits for me and baby to go home in only used two things from my hospital bag my own pillow and protein bar had the baby in the middle of the night and was so hungry but no food available until 7am the next morning so was so thankful to have food after not eating for 16 hours and doing all that work ll definitely bring my laptop and charger you wanted to be entertained after birth of beforehand that is valid concern bought one for the purpose obviously your basic toiletries including towel washcloth hairbrush hair ties if you have long hair brought my own pillow an eye mask few sheets for my bf as he was able to sleep in the room with me normal every day pjs were great to change into opposed to wandering around in that hospital gown also warm socks were pretty nice opposed to the cold tiles do forget chargers for any electronic devices and change for the vending machines your own labeled snacks if your hospital will let you bring them must say the one thing wish had that did was chapstick was possibly going to need section due to some complications so could drink or eat anything while was in labor for about 14 hours and was so dehydrated my lips physically hurt also bring book or handheld game the tv in our room sucked and could sleep was so wired plus it more than likely the last book you ll get chance to read for long time hahahaha the titty fairy comment made me giggle will definitely throw in my eye covers for good measure thank you why are they really strict on not allowing me to eat while in labor actually bought very loose fitting pajama top that was perfect for nursing and was very comfy in it to each their own this comes up in babybumps lot so it is listed in their faq here the link to the discussion what should pack in my hospital bag http www reddit com babybumps comments lprh5 hospital bag all really used were my toiletries clothes to come home in for both me and baby and camera it is worth checking ahead with your hospital to see what they provide for instance mine gave me disposable mesh underwear but not every hospital does will definitely throw some chapstick into the bag did even think of the fact that probably wont get to sit down and read books for while good point ahh good to know ll buy cheap one for the hospital apologize did see the discussion there if you need section it much safer to put you under if you have an empty stomach you could end up vomiting and suffocating guess know that in many cases you can be awake during section but guess they just want to make sure just in case they need to knock you out both but was in the hospital total of week also wanted to do this but forgot my journal is write it crazy experience even if you have super easy birth packed comfy nightgown pair of heavy socks because my feet get cold hoodie because dude it was cold in there underwear few depends type pads totally needed them and you will to trust me on this box of goldfish crackers my favorite snack book and some videos our room and the recovery room had tv vcr combos watched star trek first contact the carebears movie and the last unicorn while was in labor wanted entertainment for both but depending how labor goes your laptop or book or whatever may be the last thing on your mind lol it was for me labor was so hard and took all of my energy but afterwards for sure yeah you ll be sleeping lot but when you are learning to nurse or waiting for them to bring the baby back from testing or something you ll probably want to at least send out few pictures or updates to family and friends read while was awake most mother baby rooms have televisions but do watch too much tv when we did our hospital tour they also said to bring pillow from home but make sure it was not in white pillowcase so it would be mistaken for hospital issued pillow mine was in rainbow brite pillowcase that such good idea ll throw in journal to write with just in case that makes sense as long as know why being starved it makes it worth while after it was ok with the hospital my in laws actually went out and brought me back turkey sandwich some baked lays and bottle of vitaminwater because was starving oh my goodness definitely packing some movies to watch know the rooms have televisions and vaguely sure they have dvd player ll have to call and check when you say depends type pads are we talking full on diaper or just pads with wings like the huge ass pads with the wings they might give you some at the hospital but then again they might not you never know better to be prepared because post birth you bleed like the worst period you ve ever had and then some for oh god wan na say week maybe 10 days forget oh and just in case they do give you spritzer bottle at the hospital grab one does have to be expensive can be cheapie know that after had ds they told me needed to spritz the area with warm water several times day to clean all the gunk off the stitches from where they sliced and diced me trying to get his big ol head out my vajigglejaggle yay how exciting here are the things that were super good to have chapstick granola bar and some swedish fish was starving got the whole no eating speech but my midwife was basically if did see it it did happen kind of woman those swedish fish during labor were fantastic tiny sugar kick something to whet my palate and no nausea the granola bar after labor was the most delicious thing ve ever tasted comfy nursing bras like the ones that are more like sports bras my pillow and an extra blanket warm socks hair elastics and brush my makeup know this one is weird but really wanted to put myself back together after labor it helped my laptop yes admit it about hours after my son was born while he and my husband were sleeping quietly got on my computer and worked it shameful know deodorant forgot mine and holy crap smelled terrible things really did need to bring birth ball used the one at the hospital lots of outfits preferred the hospital gown because it was easy to nurse it and did care if it got messy and birth and recovery it messy music just labored did use any of my get me thru labor things but some people swear by music so go with your gut sweatshirts no need too bulky too up space reading material if was giving birth was parenting sleeping or working guess it makes sense that will bleed afterwards it just never occurred to me 10 days no fun had there sure ll go out and purchase some monster pads thank you thank you so much did even think of deodorant packing that in the bag right now this would also add robe just wore the hospital gowns the whole time but would throw the robe on when visitors came by bringing your own pillow and pillowcase also is great idea plus having nice colored pillowcase in back of my head for all the pictures was much better than plain white one super pale and it would have washed me out even more oh yeah some hospitals or midwives obgyns are really great about it mine actually told me could eat but labor was so intense and such hard work for me could even think about eating hated being in the hospital gown and felt sloppy especially with visitors coming in and out if we decide to have more babies definitely going to bring nightgown that do care about for the next day do you think it would be worth it for me to purchase one of those cute customizable hospital gowns only if you do mind spending 30 on something that going to get bloody and gross those tend to be skimpy as well and was cold for the entire hospital stay that matter of personal taste though pack of cotton underwear in size or two larger than normal to accommodate ice packs bought pack of fruit of the loom briefs from target get something you will be ok with throwing out after few weeks because inevitably they will be blood stained your own maxi pads the ones provided by the hospital are as thick as phone books liked always infiniti in the overnight size stock up cause no tampons for weeks postpartum if you re planning on breastfeeding nipple shells not shield shells these are sold on amazon target amp babies us made by medela philips or tommy tippee pop these on when your nips start to get sore they will allow air to get to them to allow healing nipple shields are commonly handed out in hospitals as fix for sore nips this is not what they re meant for and can cause huge problems down the road these are also handy if you have inverted nipples yoga pants for the ride home just cause they re comfy apologize in advance if wrongly assumed you were in the us for listing the stores and brand names *to clarify the shells ate good for inverted nipples not the shields egh could just as easily make one myself might do that ve never heard of nipple shells registered at babies us so ll have to look there for some next time near the store am in the us did even think of buying extra undies do mind throwing away good point ll stop by walmart soon thank you your own ply toilet paper pair of slippers that can either be washed easily or tossed took my crocks if they have to go to the bathroom after breaking your water they will get messy and gross it could be really good just before labor and incredibly bored and huge project my hospital provided mesh ones just used those until went home also ask for and try and take few home for the ice pad pads had very little pain and credit it to the cooling pads once they came out of the pack they got cold and they acted like dual ice packs and menstrual pads everything listed so far covers what would pack for me when we had our daughter 1st child my husband essentially stayed at the hospital the whole several days section he forgot to pack the daily meds for allergies and anxiety that he takes on the day after she was born he became violently ill migraine then vomiting from missing several doses to the point where wanted him to go down to the er the nurses on the ob floor are allowed to give non patients anything like advil in our case one nurse got some advil from her purse and gave it to him as friend tl dr make sure you and your so pack your daily meds if you take some yup the hospital we used sent us home with handful of monster pads but ended up buying more also if you decide to breastfeed which is totally fine if you do your ob gyn or the hospital lactation consultant may give you these well do know what else to call them turtle shells to put on your boobs they are hard round cups with little stick on backs with holes in the middle for your nipples they re supposed to make your nipples protrude more to make it easier for the baby to latch on but found them supremely uncomfortable took one of those head massagers that looks like claw like something out of claw machine http www kikkerland com products head massager also socks several pairs of socks especially the ones with rubber grips on the bottom after they broke my water had to go to the bathroom and just gushed everywhere needed new socks in hurry you should get the jolly rancher lollypops because they have stick you wo have to leave them in your mouth the lady that did my childbirth class said being able to take it out and put it back in at will decreases the chocking hazard as someone else can get it out of your mouth ve never told anyone this but was incontinent for weeks after my baby was born my ob said it was common maybe she was just trying to make me feel better had to send my husband to buy depends gt lt hahaha yep ve hit that stage upvote for chapstick oh you did nothing wrong just figured you find it helpful pj amp toiletries spent the rest of time holding the new baby if you plan on breastfeeding bring some lanolin for your nipples use it even if your nipples do hurt after the first latch trust me they will sooner or later and you ll be soooo glad you have it with you also if you can get someone to give you prescription for dr newman all nipple ointment it tha bomb for sore and cracked nipples ve already purchased some lanolin good advice ll mention the nipple ointment at my ob appointment today thanks my ipod and an ipod player but created two play lists one with pumped up music that thought want and one with quieter chill music that is what ended up wanting except only put half an hour of music on the chill music play list so we listened to the same thing over and over for 10 hours we packed snacks because knew they would allow me to have some they came in handy for my husband and my doula but was interested at all buy some cheapo pillows and got waterproof pillow covers from walmart they may get bloody dirty or left behind somewhere and you do want to mourn them same if you feel the need to bring blanket also recommend hair care bring elastics brush and small bottle of your own shampoo and conditioner the hospitals typically provide an all in one that is barely any match for the birds nest that was my hair after laboring laptop good idea mainly for post birth communication activities deodorant also good idea brought two night gowns for use in the hospital that allowed for decently easy breastfeeding bought them cheap at target so that again would care if stained them by accident from the after birth flow turned out to be an extra quality idea because had an emergency section after fetal distress meconium 20 minutes of pushing and the nightgowns were particularly easy on my incision as opposed to pants going home outfit ended up having my mom pick up maxi dress from my closet so that could wear it home without irritating my incision but originally brought comfy shirt and yoga pants tennis balls tennis balls tennis balls they were key during labor my baby was faced the wrongish way so had bad back labor and could not get enough of being rubbed on my back with the tennis balls camera if you re going in with partner who will be with you the whole time pack them change of clothes too just in case other random toiletries tooth brush body wash moisturizer for back body massaging during labor my doula recommended eucerin because it does pill up and remains pretty good lubrication for constant rubbing everybody is saying socks that true but also packed cheap set of slippers for post birth use it made me feel extra put together to be walking around in almost real shoes shower flip flops showering in public hospital college showers squicks me out without wearing something on my feet so the dollar old navy flip flops were my buddy there also brought book and sudoku but that was dumb because was kind of busy with other things good luck edit and going home outfit for the baby comfy stuff warm socks good pillow things like that the hospital bed seriously lacks comfort at least in my experience and if your so is going to be sleeping on that godawful couch or chair they have in the room suggest that they bring some stuff too lol bring some of your favorite drink snack yes there are vending machines and yes the hospital provides your food but would still suggest bringing some have particular drink like and it not available in most vending machines also the vending machines rip you off get few bottles big bag at the grocery store also laptop smartphone etc your camera charger clothes for your so do forget contact case if he wears contacts forgot oops couple different sizes of outfits for baby newborn babies are all different sizes if he big you might not be able to use newborn did have problem but few friends suggested that to me before my little boy was born **what they provide ** diapers wipes large pads mesh underwear personal hygiene toothpaste shampoo conditioner toothbrush floss **what to bring ** baby clothes they may provide some but you ca take them with you comfy warm socks nursing bras if you plan to nurse personal hygiene if you prefer your own smartphone tablet laptop snacks the hospital cafeteria had room service that was very tasty but after 8pm it was closed personal wipes carseat comfortable shoes to go home something to keep so busy entertained we packed bunch of stuff for entertainment did not get to use any of it went quite fast and was in full blown transition quickly then popping out baby lol pushed to get discharged quickly the next day as everything was great biggest thing for us was snacks change of clothes for both me and hubs we used what the hospital provided so we did bring lot first kid in the hospital for 29 hrs second was 48 hrs hospital policy to be kept for 36 hrs after giving birth if you were gbs chapstick hairbands an hair ties phone charger pillow tank did have nursing tank but it was as good as it was nice to have under the hospital gown and helped me feel covered while learning to breastfeed socks hate hospital socks so much camera music player sound machine post delivery wanted no monkey business during amp we used the tv but it was bit obnoxious bathroom supplies my hospital did provide anything not even towels so ask hem beforehand what is provided going home clothes for me and baby suggest for baby taking few different outfits of differing sizes we expected an lb baby and she was born just under lbs she did fit anything we brought there were couple extra trips between birth and discharge we decided not to take our laptop and that worked out because had no interest to do anything except look at my baby could barely sleep well there about 10 reasons for that but still so why would want *something else* taking away my attention from my baby of course sure my so would have appreciated it but he was trooper and never once complained also he was the one that actually decided not to bring it anyway good luck hope everything goes smoothly but above all hope for healthy momma and baby gbs group strep positive refused antibiotics did lot of research and we felt good in that decision for us it is not if you have been tested for it yet it will likely happen when your around 36 weeks pregnant very easy it is just swab ll add my first labor from first contraction till she was out was hrs and second was an induction with cervadil and from the time of insertion was hrs and 15 mins had my water broken with the first at 10 cm and 40 mins later she was out 2nd at cm and she was out in mins because of my history of short labor was why we chose to not get the antibiotics they need to be given at least hrs apart to even be maybe effective we followed the uk procedure for antibiotics which tends to be watch for warning signs also was only gbs with my second talk about lifesaver would bring and did for my second comfy jammies some old granny panties at least couple pairs and overnight menstrual pads lip chap and something really comfortable to wear home like something that will look decent in pics but you wo feel too constricted in like trackpants and tanktop or nice maturity nursing lounge set make up if you like you will be exsaused but you might want to feel better by putting makeup on know did your phone book or something to keep you occupied lanolin in case you decide to nurse but they have that there and pj for baby to wear home and the baby carseat used the hospital dvd player to distract me from labour did watch anything but the noise of movie was soothing to me just before had my son was listening to gladiator pads absorbent pads get the really good ones do skimp super heavy flow pads all of them wipes flushable for you mouthwash water free shampoo lip stuff what ever your absolute fave is and disposable breastpads if you are breast feeding also if you are breastfeeding bring really **supportive** nursing tank top bravado makes basic tank for nursing and maternity so it is perfection everyone seems to be mentioning nursing tank top ll definitely be checking bravado for the basic tank thank you where failed snacks for my husband he passed out before my last section low blood sugar plus watching them out in my iv he hit the floor hard enough that the nurses made him go to the er if had any granola bars or trail mix or even pack of skittles he could have been munching on those when he complained of hunger an hour before also hear lip balm is wise addition ll be sure to store some snacks for the hubby definitely snacks the hospital where gave birth had horrible snack bar and my husband had to actually leave the hospital to get food if you re doing vaginal birth instead of menstrual pads go for the depends seriously you wo have to worry about pasting anything on your underwear and you can throw them out when you re done had to be induced due to preeclampsia so we spent an agonizing night in the hospital me on hard hospital bed hooked up to pitocin magnesium sulfate and something else ended up dilating only to cm overnight had to have my water broken at 8am and ended up giving birth very quickly by 9:54am now that remember all that screaming from the pain even after epidurals bring some cough drops went home with major sore throat or just try not to scream like dying hyena if you have boppy pillow bring it brought one outfit to go home in and spent the rest of my time wearing the hospital gowns also took my cross stitch and some books but was so tired that could make my eyes focus for more than minutes at time small personal fan is good idea too the temperature in my postpartum room would regulate well at all hot as hell during the day and freezing at night do know if this was said since there are so many comments but had to bring my own snacks after awhile the food even for two days was all that filling especially when trying to breastfeed couple of people mentioned this ve already packed couple of snacks for the hubby but do think ve packed enough for few days at the hospital thinking will wait and send friends and family out to get food you can always see if the hospital has their own fridge you can use thats where we kept our things like pudding or yogurts my hospital only had few large pads had vaginal delivery the nurses said they were like gold around there suggest buying some poise pads they are marketed for bladder issues but let me tell ya they are absorbent might be tmi but bled alot in the few hours afterward and it would have been wonderful not to have to go to the bathroom every 20 mins to change
